alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 4:13AM CST until February 27 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain, Snow Overnight Through Monday... .A potent, quick moving storm system will bring freezing rain and snow to the region overnight through the day Monday. Freezing rain spreads into and north of Interstate 94 overnight, starting to mix with and then change over to snow by mid to late Monday morning. Snow persists, mostly north of Highway 10 in north-central Wisconsin, through the afternoon with the storm exiting northeast in the evening. Icing up to 1/4" is possible. With winds expected to gust into the mid 30s mph, areas that receive the heavier icing could experience tree damage and power outages. The bulk of the snow accumulations will be confined north of Highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin with a few inches possible. Temperatures will play a key role in what falls where, and how much. Small changes could result in shifts in precipitation types and amounts. Pay close attention to later forecasts for any revisions to what is expected. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and snow expected. Icing around 1/4 inch and snow of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...precipitation starts as freezing rain, gradually mixing with and changing over to snow late Monday morning into the afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
